summary.p: The Kācikāṇṭam, The book of Kāci, that is Kāśī (Benares), is a Tamil version of the Kāśīkhaṇḍa of the late version of the Sanskrit Skandapurāṇa. The Kācikāṇṭam is the work of the Teṉkāci (Southern Kāśī) king Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, who ruled in the second half of the 16th century. See Raghavan (1960, p. 235). On Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, best known for his Naiṭatam, a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Naiṣadha by Harṣa, see Shulman (2012, pp. 155ff.).
Paratexts: marginal benedictions, title-pages, invocation page, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, occasionally total stanzas, colophon.

filiation.p: Bnf Indien 332 and 334; GOML D. 565‒566 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 549ff.).

extent.note: 365 mm is in fact the maximum breadth observed. Folios in U1‒U3 are conspicuously smaller in breadth, as are folios at the end of U4. The folios have been resized on purpose (sometimes at the cost of truncating the original foliation, e.g., first folios in U3), so as to give the bundle a specific shape.

collation.desc: 1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
1 folio = Title Page. Verso blank. In big letters, in Roman transcription and in French.
15 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Title Page & Table of Contents. Tamil foliation [1]‒15.
1 folio = Kācikāṇṭam: Title Page. Tamil foliation [1]. In big letters, in Tamil.
14 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Table of Contents. Tamil foliation 2‒15.

267 folios = Kācikāṇṭam. Tamil foliation 1-268. Parallel Arabic foliation 1-246 for ff. 1‒247 (discrepancy due to the fact that there is no folio foliated 147 in Tamil, thus Tamil foliated 148 = Arabic foliated 147). Parallel Tamil foliation 1‒21, Roman numerals foliation I-XXI for ff. 248‒268.
1 folio = Kācikāṇṭam: Invocation. Parallel Tamil foliation 1 and Arabic foliation 1. Verso blank.
266 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Mūlam. Tamil foliation 2-268 and parallel foliations (see description of U4 above).

additions.desc:
A paper leaf comes along with the bundle, with a text in French on the recto:
Mr Ducler, N° 37 intutule [i.e. intitulé] Casicandame, ou Histoire du Gange ou, Mythologie indienne, Depuis Naradeine ou Vischenou, jusqu’à Vitsouranadeine, (ouvrage anonyme) Contenant 290 Feuilles.

origin.origDate: See colophon, U4, f267r. 1731 according to Cabaton (1912, p. 48), who probably misread the numeral "9" for "1".

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 80.
